snippet: Faced with repeated barrages of snow, ice and sleet, New York City and surrounding communities are using up their road-salt supplies at a rapid rate.
abstract: New York City and surrounding communities are using up their road-salt supplies at rapid rate as they face repeated barrages of snow, ice and sleet in year's rough winter; officials are scrambling to restock as more storms and snowy weather are expected.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Kia Gregory, Michael M. Grynbaum, Patrick McGeehan and Kate Taylor.

lead_paragraph: Faced with repeated barrages of snow, ice and sleet, New York City and surrounding communities are using up their road-salt supplies at a rapid rate.

headline.main: In the Breath Between Winter Storms, Officials Scramble to Find More Salt
headline.print_headline: In the Breath Between Winter Storms, Officials Scramble to Find More Salt
